pos: Betty leans over the hood of the car
My Serpents have been fighting with the Ghoulies for years
We race and whoever loses, has to leave Riverdale
The Ghoulies are attempting to take over the Southside
ctx: What does bother him is that fact that the Serpents are a gang.
FP understands why his son is furious at the deal made between the Ghoulies and the Serpents, but he wishes Jughead would understand why the deal was made.
I'm a Southside Serpent,
The anger Jughead feels comes from the loyalty to the Serpents, and FP knows that Jughead will always put them first.
The leader is a dark haired boy who is strangely familiar to Archie.
Jughead enters the room with two other Serpents; the tall boy and the pink haired girl Cheryl clashed with in the hallway earlier that day.
Their fighting was destroying the Southside and that was not something anyone could afford.

pos: Brute forcing a search isn't going to give us anything
ctx: GAIA sits gracefully, perfectly, like a Goddess with a Focus field adorning her
The existence of APOLLO is something I was unaware of until now
They're all convinced that APOLLO had indeed been destroyed, however.
I currently have three subordinate functions attempting to reintegrate and report.

Rebooting GAIA with three of the former subordinate functions makes it just possible, and HEPHAESTUS had said that GAIA would be limited, not at full power, especially with GAIA Prime not fully repaired yet.
APOLLO had tried to contact her, she'd sensed things that had alarmed her, and she'd rejected the contact.
I believe APOLLO has been acting secretly for many years now

It's another hour before MINERVA and Vanasha are ready, and Varl spends that time talking to Aloy through the Focus network, sending her images of the opened ELEUTHIA facility and describing what he finds.

The ELEUTHIA-9 Cradle is enormous. With MINERVA's help, ELEUTHIA had finally overridden most of the directives keeping the facility closed. Only the APOLLO database still remains cut off from her, and even MINERVA's skill had made no headway against it.
watching the way that the room behind GAIA very faintly shimmers through the hologram
It takes exactly the amount of time HEPHAESTUS had said to rebuild the core and get the system running again.
MINERVA detected the effects of particle annihilation imprinted on APOLLO's nanorobotic composition
ELEUTHIA had said the same thing as MINERVA and HEPHAESTUS, when asked.
It is undetectable to me
Meanwhile, APOLLO is somehow alive, has contacted at least three of the former subordinate functions, and succeeded somewhat in turning one against humanity.

pos: laughing at my jokes and poking fun at me
deep conversations and the casual, random chats
her original group of friends have already graduated
neighbors are of the same nationality
ctx: I watched Jae always look at Jaehee whenever she's in the room, amused and in admiration of everything she says and does when he's not busy joking around and laughing with her.
Park Jaehyung who has a six months advantage over myself.
And we laugh it off like old friends.
She then turns to me. "Jae, did Dowoon tell you who was at the lecture today?"
Yeah. Jae, Sungjin, and Dowoon are all SNU graduates.
Jaehee noona laughs, breaking the proverbial ice.
She laughs.
She tells me anecdotes of her grad school life, and I share my stories as a team leader in the marketing and sales department.
She laughs at this.
On my third day in Japan, I decided to try and rope Yoon Dowoon into the anime tour Jaehee mentioned last night.

I feel like this is my cue to go.
  (laughing at my jokes and poking fun at me)
I see her eyes widen in surprise, and I quickly pat her head and run towards my apartment.
It's always very easy to make her laugh.
She responds with a smile and says, “I always trust you, Jae.”
I already forgot he was here.

pos: Evil on your mind, Trouble at your feet, Living by the gun, Devil… The Devil's got you beat.
ctx: _June 20 1791 - Tuileries Palace, Paris, France_

pos: Without Dean Winchester in his life
He's never been the type to let himself be swayed by pretty eyes
it's not a feeling he likes
his life has grown more boring; no; it has simply returned to what it was before
what is it about Dean Winchester?
A few weeks later, Crowley has come to admit something to himself
blackmailing him to get information, text him just because he can or inviting him to dinner
This time, he's sneaky, oh so very sneaky
it's a bit of a relief when Winchester starts his next attack on his business
Rather, he's annoyed at himself that he allowed the agent to take up so much of his time
ctx: God knows he's been paying him enough attention. It's time he becomes a top priority.
Crowley comes home to his favourite mansion last night, trying to convince himself that he's not disappointed that Dean Winchester didn't show up at his office;
Even if he has never quite had an opponent as intriguing as Dean Winchester.
No FBI agent would dare start an affair with someone lie him.
Their eyes meet. And that right there is why Dean has had those decidedly inappropriate fantasies.
But Dean Winchester… he's the first threat, the first real threat, that has presented itself in years, and that alone would be enough to capture Crowley's attention.
And he saved Crowley's life when he didn't have to, just because he apparently wanted to.
He's not even annoyed by wanting Dean Winchester and at the same time having to make sure he never finds any evidence of his work.
And now he's come and proven he can just as easily infiltrate one of Dean's party as the agent himself has shown up at his meals.
And he's sure he can Crowley in a fight.
The relief he feels surprises him. Surely he can't have been that concerned for a FBI agent, and one who's after him, no less?
And then his instincts kick in. Someone is watching them, he can tell.
There's only one person it could be from, and he finds it rather annoying that his heart starts picking up a beat as he reads it.
If Winchester finds the shipment, he'll put him away, and aside from all other inconveniences, it would mean seeing less of the agent than he has in the past few weeks.
Dean Winchester is rather more dashing than he has any right to be; certainly, more handsome than whoever it is who plays James Bond at the moment.
Well it would just be a shame to waste that pretty face.
And yet Crowley has helped him out on several occasions.
Crowley should resent it but can't; he's always respected those who can look after themselves and threaten others while doing so
Powerful as he is, he'll admit he used to grow bored now and then; not anymore.
Dean knows exactly what happened, he can tell. It's the sparkle in those damn eyes.
Being beholden means he'll see Dean Winchester again, or he'll call him and demand information – either way it means they'll still be talking.
Dear God, what is it about agent Winchester?
He sighs and forbids himself from ending Crowley more messages.
Because now it's personal.
Of all the things Crowley expected to happen tonight, him joining the cause of the angels, and may it be only for a few short moments, wasn't one of them.

an agent who has not yet used that knowledge to demand anything from him, pretends that he isn't in regular contact with the very mafia boss he's supposed to catch in front of his colleagues; and still has the very irritating habit of spontaneously showing up wherever Crowley happens to be.
Trouble is, Crowley isn't.
If only he weren't so attractive.
FBI agents usually don't keep contact with their target, do they? Not the way he and Dean do, at any rate.
It's just been so long since he's had a challenge, and Crowley is providing a worthy one.
Crowley doesn't want things he can't have. For the simple reason that he invariably gets what he wants.
Somehow Crowley likes this world a little better with Dean Winchester in it.
And it's not even boring.
Someone like Crowley wasn't going to take Dean sneaking up on him all the time lying down.
